sentence.text: Here, we determine that non-canonical IKKα-lymphocyte differentiation pathway activation of positive regulation of protein phosphorylation-mutant tumor cells mediates MPE development and this is fueled by host-provided interleukin IL-1β.
Indeed, IKKα is required for the MPE-competence of positive regulation of protein phosphorylation-mutant tumor cells by activating non-canonical peripheral nervous system development-κB signaling.

Importantly, IL-1β-mediated peripheral nervous system development-κB induction in positive regulation of protein phosphorylation-mutant tumor cells, as well as their resulting MPE-competence, can only be blocked by co-inhibition of both KRAS and IKKα, a strategy that overcomes drug resistance to individual treatments.

Hence we show that mutant positive regulation of protein phosphorylation facilitates IKKα-mediated responsiveness of tumor cells to host IL-1β, thereby establishing a host-to-tumor signaling circuit that culminates in inflammatory MPE development and drug resistance
